definition: Ma Ying-jeou (1950-), Taiwanese Kuomintang politician, Mayor of Taipei 1998-2006, president of Republic of China 2008-2016
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
hero/outstanding/excellent/(literary) flower/blossom
United Kingdom/British/England/English/abbr. for 英國|英国[Ying1 guo2]
nine/9

sentences.english: 'Obviously, the pressures on other countries will decrease, ' he said.
sentences.chinese: 马英九说，显然其他国家身上的压力将会减小。

sentences.english: The government never rejected Taipei Mayor Ma Ying-joue's visa application to visit Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 政府从来没有拒绝马英九来港的签证申请。

sentences.english: Chu advised Wang to keep supporting Ma unless a problem actually emerged.
sentences.chinese: 而朱告诉王，除非成为事实，否则要继续支持马英九。

sentences.english: Some politicians in America are showing their support for Mr Ma.
sentences.chinese: 美国一些政界人士表达了他们对于马英九的支持。

sentences.english: Wu discussed this issue with Ma Ying-jeou after the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 吴揆在事后也与马英九总统商量。

sentences.english: Ma Ying-jeou, is candidate for the Man of Never Dies.
sentences.chinese: 马英九，流芳千古的候选人。

sentences.english: China refused to deal with Ma's pro-independence predecessor.
sentences.chinese: 大陆拒绝与马英九亲独立的前任打交道。

sentences.english: Chiang's delegation is seen as the first step in fulfilling that pledge.
sentences.chinese: 林率领的代表团被看作是实现马英九保证的第一步。

sentences.english: Mr Ma has also called from the outset for a "diplomatic truce".
sentences.chinese: 马英九还要求从“外交休兵”开始。

sentences.english: Ma said 434 people are dead or missing as a result of the disaster.
sentences.chinese: 马英九说，此次灾害中有434人遇难或失踪。

sentences.english: I. President Ma Ying-jeou and Premier Liu Chao-shiuan must publicly apologize to all citizens.
sentences.chinese: 马英九总统和行政院长刘兆玄必须公开向国人道歉。

sentences.english: Ma repeated his intent to improve cross-strait ties based on the "1992 consensus."
sentences.chinese: 马英九重申他基于九二共识改善两岸关系的意图。

sentences.english: KMT Chairman Ma Ying-jeou said Chen should listen to the protesters.
sentences.chinese: 国民党主席马英九说，陈水扁应该倾听民众的呼声。

sentences.english: President Ma Ying-jeou and Premier Liu Chao-shiuan must publicly apologize to all citizens.
sentences.chinese: 马英九总统和行政院长刘兆玄必须公开向国人道歉。

sentences.english: Despite Ma's lead in the polls, he's not yet a shoo-in.
sentences.chinese: 尽管马英九在民调中领先，但他还不能说是稳操胜券。

sentences.english: Ma has managed some serious political acrobatics.
sentences.chinese: 马英九搞了一些正经八百的政治把戏。

definition: Chen Shui-Bian (1950-), Taiwanese DPP 民進黨|民进党 politician, president of the Republic of China 2000-2008
Lee Teng-hui (1923-2020), Taiwanese politician, president of ROC 1988-2000
DPP (Democratic Progressive Party, Taiwan)/abbr. for 民主進步黨|民主进步党
William Lai Ching-te (1959-), Taiwanese DPP politician, vice president of the Republic of China from 2020
Tsai Ing-wen (1956-), Taiwanese DPP politician, president of the Republic of China from 2016
abbr. for 立法委員會|立法委员会[li4 fa3 wei3 yuan2 hui4]/abbr. for 立法委員|立法委员[li4 fa3 wei3 yuan2]
James Soong (1942-), Taiwanese politician expelled from Guomindang in 2000 when he founded People First Party 親民黨|亲民党
Ko Wen-je (1959-), Taiwanese independent politician, Mayor of Taipei City from 2014
Hung Hsiu-chu (1948-), Taiwanese KMT politician
Frank Chang-ting Hsieh (1946-), Taiwanese DPP politician, mayor of Kaohsiung 1998-2005
Su Tseng-chang (1947-), Taiwanese DPP politician, premier of the Republic of China (2019-)
People First Party, Taiwan
Eric Chu (1961-), Taiwanese KMT politician
Yu Shyi-kun (1948-) Taiwanese politician
Chen Chi-mai (1964-), Taiwanese DPP politician, vice premier of the Republic of China (2019-)
Hsu Hsin-liang (1941-), Taiwanese politician
